title: Woman who conned NHS out of a nose job is ‘forced to move home’
text:
NHS already buckling under the pressure, but one mum of three has no shame about milking the system for all it’s worth (Picture: Sun)

A former glamour model who blagged a free nose job by pretending to be depressed has received a major public backlash.

Carla Bellucci, 38, says she has had to take her children out of school and is now even considering moving house.

The mum from Borehamwood in Hertfordshire, originally said she ‘didn’t care what people said’ after milking the NHS for the free op worth £7,000.

But now the trolling against her has become so vociferous that she has changed her tune.

She said she has taken her three children Jermaine, 16, Tanisha, 14, and Jayden, 12, out of school and claimed she did not feel safe at home after people threw eggs.

But, astonishingly, she said she would do it all again and has even blamed the NHS for carrying out the procedure.

Influencers need to have the look of the time (Picture: Carla Bellucci/Instagram)

The mum-of-three told the Sun: ‘I know I’ve brought it on myself but it’s unbearable. My children can’t even go to school, they are being home-schooled.

‘I get called a slag and scum whenever I walk down the street. I can’t go anywhere in my neighbourhood.

‘I have received death threats on Instagram. People say I don’t deserve to have kids and they wish I would die in a car crash.’

Undeterred Ms Bellucci is looking for more free surgery – although she thinks it may be a push to get the NHS to pay for her ‘Brazillan bum lift’.

Incensed at having to stump up for the vanity work herself she has launched a crowdfunding page but could not help taking a swipe at the NHS.

She told the Star: ‘I have to have a bum lift and I am out of work and I can’t pay for it myself and I so need a new bum.

Carla and her daughter Tanisha (Picture: Instagram/officialcarlabellucci)

‘I need it for my mental health, for my self-esteem and it is just something that I need doing so bad and I know I can’t pay for it.

‘The NHS definitely won’t pay for it this time. (I) don’t know why, transgenders get operations left, right and centre but they will not pay for my bum lift.’
